title: Incorrect keyboard mapping in Youtube
content:
I recently disabled a couple of extensions that could be used to download video etc from Youtube. I believe the extensions were Easy Youtube Video Downloader Express and Video DownloadHelper.

Since disabling the extensions the keyboard shortcuts that you can use in Youtube to control video playback no longer work and functions e.g. sound levels that could be adjusted by using the mouse cursor also fail to work. It seems to me that the keyboard and mouse mapping has gone wrong for Youtube but it is fine for all other websites.

I do not get any error messages, just an inability to control video or sound using the keyboard or mouse.

As Youtube works fine with other browers I performed a complete reset of Firefox, version 96.0.3, as I thought that that would reset any error that might have occured when the extensions were disabled. I have reinstated 3 other extensions but at this time have not installed the Youtube ones again.

The keyboard mapping and mouse cursor problems still exist when I try use use Youtube through my now reset copy of Firefox.

Please could anyone offer a solution that would get my keyboard working correctly again with Youtube through Firefox?

Nigel

title: Problema con los certificados digitales
content:
Buenos días, este mensaje no es para realizar una pregunta, es para exponer lo que he averiguado cuando tenemos un certificado digital caducado y lo borramos y al realizar una vertificación de los certificados que tenemos instalado, este, continúa apareciendo aunque lo hayamos borrado; así como, si hemos actualizado un certificado caducado, al verificarlo continúa apareciendo el caducado.

Este problema se presenta cuando se dan dos condiciones:

1º.- Tenemos varios certificados instalados 2º.- Tenemos varios perfiles de firefox activos

El problema ocurre porque, firefox, al buscar el baúl de los certificados, busca en el baúl del perfil que se instaló primero, no busca en el que estamos trabajando.

Acabo de comprobarlo, tengo instalado varios perfiles, por orden se instalaron así: Firefox 87, Firefox 57 y Firefox 96 Trabajo con el 96, pero el primero que se instaló es el 87

He borrado un certificado en el 96, he ido a comprobar el certificado en la web Valide y me aparece el certificado borrado. He actualizado el certificado, que estaba caducado, y no aparece, continúa apareciendo el caducado. He borrado el certificado del 87, y desde el 96 he vuelto a realizar la misma comprobación y ahora no me aparece, aunque en el 96 está instalado; lo he actualizado en el 87 y desde el 96 he vuelto a hacer la comprobración y ahora si aparece y actualizado. (Por supuesto que a cada borrado o actualizado he reiniciado el Firefox).

Lo expongo por si alguien tiene este problema.

Saludos

title: Open link with an anchor point in combination with config 'browser.link.open_newwindow=1' doesn't work anymore
content:
This feature works fine untill Firefox 78.15esr and is broken afterwards. Firefox 91.0 already has this issue an it still exist in the current version Firefox 96.0.

Feature: Our customers want to work with a single Window/Tab, because our Web-Application fequently interacts with an external application. The external opens links with anchor points and these links should be displayed always in the same Window and Tab - and same http session. We applied the configuration browser.link.open_newwindow=1. This worked fine until version 78.15esr

Problem: Now the feature is broken. If our application opens a link for the first time, all went fine. But the second link does not. The second link is displayed in the firefox navigation field but the page is not refreshed. If I press the refresh button manually, the new link is displayed, but not at the correct anchor point.

Reproducer: check out these links with a one Window/Tab configuration: https://www.tutorialscollection.com/faq/html-link-hyperlink-how-to-create-link-in-html-with-a-href-with-examples/#HTML_mailtolink https://www.tutorialscollection.com/faq/html-link-hyperlink-how-to-create-link-in-html-with-a-href-with-examples/#The_HTML_ltagt_tag Or any other links with anchor tags - both should be from the same web application.

title: Suppress "Cookie ABC will be soon treated as cross-site cookie against XYZ because the scheme does not match." in console?
content:
Hello,

I'm a web developer.

I'm working on a site that downloads a bunch of 3rd-party trackers that set 1st- and 3rd- party cookies.

In development mode, the site is running on "http://localhost:8080". Naturally production is `https` and everything is fine there.

However, during local development, whenever I open the dev console, I get a ton of warnings like

> Cookie XXX will be soon treated as cross-site cookie against YYY because the scheme does not match.

A whole ton of them. Every time.

I'm fine with them being soon treated as cross-site cookies, I really am. I just... don't want to hear about that again, okay? I like my console telling me important things, for debugging and whatnot. These messages are irrelevant, though. I know what I'm doing. It's not a problem here in these circimstances. Where's my "OK, agreed, understand the risks, don't tell me again" button?

How can I suppress these messages?

title: Bookmarks menu on FF 40/96 for iOS 15.3
content:
Hello, when FF for iOS updated to version 40/96 a strange and annoying thing happened with the bookmarks menu, you open FF to your homepage, tap the hamburger button and select Bookmarks (and it opens to that also very annoying display of all your recently marked), you then select Bookmarks Menu and scroll to the folder you need (maybe even a sub folder) and select the bookmark you are looking for (all pretty normal so far, right?). Well, that wasn’t the one you needed after all, musta been the one next to it (Here is where we get to that strange and annoying part). You tap on the hamburger button again, expecting to still be in the same bookmark folder, but alas, you find yourself back at the very beginning (the default BM menu) again.

I apologize for the long narrative, but it may serve for you to know what it feels like to have to keep starting over every time the bookmark menu is opened. To what end does that serve? It obviously couldn’t be for the sake of privacy or FF would be courteous enough to allow us an option to hide the Recently Bookmarked if one should so desire. I do understand why it would go back to default upon browser restart, but not upon closing the menu, there is no option to keep that open. Could someone please put that back the way it was? PLEEEEAASE?
creator: lpsears63

title: Las páginas se mueven solas hasta que presiono alguna tecla del teclado.
